description: From Japanese 片仮名(かたかな) (katakana).

nouns.description: katakana (countable and uncountable, plural katakana or katakanas)

entries.meaning: (uncountable) A Japanese syllabary used when writing words borrowed from foreign languages other than Chinese, specific names of plants and animals and other jargon, onomatopoeia, or to emphasize a word or phrase. Also used to write the Ainu language.
